title: Tupelo By Chef Adrienne Grenier To Pop Up At Fort Lauderdale Marriott Harbor Beach Resort & Spa
text:
Fort Lauderdale Marriott Harbor Beach Resort & Spa
During renovation of 3030 Ocean, unique restaurant concept from Food Network 'Chopped' champion will feature small and large dishes along with hand-crafted cocktails
FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. - Fort Lauderdale Marriott Harbor Beach Resort & Spa will welcome Tupelo, a unique pop-up restaurant concept by 3030 Ocean chef de cuisine Adrienne Grenier .
Taking inspiration from the Tupelo tree, whose short bloom season produces a rare type of honey, this limited-time Fort Lauderdale pop-up restaurant will give guests the opportunity to experience Grenier's signature cooking style, which won her the title of champion on Food Network's Chopped .
Grenier has developed Tupelo to be a one-of-a-kind eatery for hotel guests and locals to enjoy while 3030 Ocean is closed and undergoing an expansive renovation. Tupelo will be open from Monday, Aug. 24 to Friday, Oct. 23, 2015 , in the resort's Riva restaurant space. Dinner service will begin at 6 p.m. daily.
The concept's imaginative menu consists of a variety of small and large plates - along with sweet treats - perfectly paired with a creative list of hand-crafted cocktails. The menu is thoughtfully designed to encourage sharing and emphasize fresh, seasonal, high quality and locally sourced ingredients.
Plates at the Fort Lauderdale restaurant will include warm cheddar biscuits with honey butter ($9) , smoked fish dip with grilled bread ($11) and roasted beets served with a parsley-walnut pesto, arugula and goat cheese ($14) . Guests will also be able to share several farm-to-table inspired items including the rock shrimp pasta with garlic, tomato and basil ($17) ; seared scallops with creamy polenta and charred corn succotash ($19) ; roasted chicken with chorizo rice grits and black bean puree ($21) ; and Palmetto Creek Farms Jim's pork chop hickory rubbed, served with smashed potatoes, Brussels sprouts and mustard ($30) . Tupelo's delectable desserts include fresh berries and cream - tupelo honey and shortbread ($12) ; warm chocolate brownie - walnuts, dulce de leche and vanilla ice cream ($12) ; and an old-fashioned favorite â€“ root beer float ($10) .
The 128-seat pop-up restaurant's upbeat music will accentuate the Riva space's personable and inviting atmosphere. The dining room's communal tables will encourage warm and friendly interactions among diners.
A South Florida native, Grenier has spent much of her career at 3030 Ocean under the tutelage of acclaimed chefs Paula DaSilva and Dean Max . In 2011, Grenier's work with DaSilva at 1500 Degrees at Eden Roc Renaissance Miami Beach helped win the restaurant a coveted spot as the only Florida restaurant in food critic John Mariani's annual Esquire magazine feature, "The Best New Restaurants in America." Her passion for food and cooking also led her to become a champion on Food Network's popular culinary competition Chopped in January 2012.
Reservations are suggested by calling 1-954-525-4000 ext. 3129 or visiting www.TupeloHarborBeach.com . Valet and self-parking are available at the resort.
About Fort Lauderdale Marriott Harbor Beach Resort & Spa
Fort Lauderdale Marriott Harbor Beach Resort & Spa at 3030 Holiday Drive in Fort Lauderdale, FL is one of the city's premier resorts, sitting on 16 oceanfront acres, including a quarter mile of private beach. The palm tree-lined grounds, luxurious spa, award-winning restaurants, 3030 Ocean and Sea Level Restaurant & Ocean Bar and soothing suites provide the perfect, rejuvenating escape. Located just 10 minutes from Fort Lauderdale / Hollywood International Airport (FLL), Marriott Harbor Beach offers guests tropical seclusion with all the exciting dining, shopping, entertainment and cultural options of the city at its doorstep. For information, visit www.HarborBeachMarriott.com or call 1-954-525-4000. To stay up to date on the latest news and happenings, follow the resort on Twitter and Facebook .
